title: Sarah Jessica Parker reveals the secret to her happy marriage to Matthew Broderick
text:
They're one of Hollywood's longest-lasting couples, having been together for almost three decades.

And on Tuesday, Sarah Jessica Parker revealed the secret to her happy marriage to actor Matthew Broderick, whom she wed in 1997.

Speaking on Australian TV show The Project on Tuesday night, the Sex and the City star said: 'I really like my husband!'

Long-lasting couple: Sarah Jessica Parker (left) has revealed the secret to her happy marriage, despite saying her husband Matthew Broderick (right) 'annoys her' after 28 years together

Sarah, 54, added: 'We've been together 28 years and I really do like him.

'I'm sure I'm annoying and, you know, there are times that he annoys me, and that's what makes it interesting!'

Sarah went on to say that she hopes working alongside Matthew on the upcoming Broadway production of Neil Simon's Plaza Suite won't put a strain on their marriage.

Candid: Speaking on The Project on Tuesday, Sarah said: 'I really like my husband... I'm sure I'm annoying and there are times that he annoys me, and that's what makes it interesting!'

'I like him and I admire him, and I'm hopeful our marriage can weather this experiment,' she said.

Elsewhere in the interview, Sarah revealed that she and Matthew are determined to give their twin daughters Marion and Tabitha, 10, and son James, 16, normal childhoods away from the hustle and bustle of Hollywood.

'We want very much for our children to have their own lives,' she said.

Wedded bliss: Sarah, who is best known for her role as Carrie Bradshaw in Sex and the City, married Matthew on May 19, 1997 in Manhattan, New York. Pictured on April 18, 2018

'We like living in a city where we walk out of our home and we're on the streets and we're joining everybody in our community and we know the people in our grocery stores and we care about our neighbours and our local businesses.'

Sarah, who is best known for her role as Carrie Bradshaw in Sex and the City, married Matthew, 57, on May 19, 1997 in Manhattan, New York.

They welcomed son James on October 28, 2002, and daughters Marion and Tabitha via a surrogate on June 22, 2009.
